thread.section_title: Science News and Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Deutsche Bank Executives to Give Up Bonuses for Third Consecutive Year

author: Jenny Strasburg
title: Deutsche Bank Executives to Give Up Bonuses for Third Consecutive Year
text:
News Deutsche Bank executives to give up bonuses for third consecutive year Chief Executive John Cryan’s comments come after the German lender last month reported full-year loss By Jenny Strasburg March 10, 2018 Updated: 6:09 p.m. GMT 
Deutsche Bank top executives will forgo bonuses for a third consecutive year, chief executive John Cryan said at a technology and music conference in Austin, Texas, according to a spokesman on Saturday, The Wall Street Journal reports. 
Cryan’s comments, made Friday night at Austin’s South By Southwest, came after the German lender last month reported a third consecutive full-year loss. Despite the loss, Deutsche Bank’s total 2017 employee bonus payout will more than triple the previous year’s €546m ($672m), according to a... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In Filter by Topic
